item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Live Trade! - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Live Trade! - NEWSBTC

Here's a look at what we are focusing on in the bitcoin price this evening, with a look at one of our live trades. The markets are about to draw to a close in Europe, and it's time to take our second look of the day at the bitcoin price.

item.title: University of Cantabria in Spain Offers Summer Bitcoin Course
item.description:
University of Cantabria in Spain Offers Summer Bitcoin Course

University of Cantabria, a public Spanish university located in Santander, Torrelavega and Comillas, has announced the introduction of a summer Bitcoin course led by Telecommunications engineers Steven Vaerenbergh and Oscar Gonzalez, and mathematician Claudiu Tanasescu.

item.title: Bitcoin Scam Site Warning - JoltCorp
item.description:
Bitcoin Scam Site Warning - JoltCorp

Albeit it has become rather easy to distinguish between Bitcoin scam sites, we will continue to uncover the pitfalls unknowing cryptocurrency enthusiasts may fall for. Joltcorp may appear to be a professional cloud mining company, but it does not take much to see they will run off with investor funds at some stage.

item.title: Report: Mt Gox CEO Mark Karpeles out of Jail on Bail
item.description:
Report: Mt Gox CEO Mark Karpeles out of Jail on Bail

Mark Karpeles, CEO of now-defunct bitcoin exchange Mt Gox has been released on bail from a detention house in Tokyo, according to a local report. A news report by local Japanese media outlet news24 has revealed that Mt Gox CEO Mark Karpeles paid Â¥10 million (approximately $95k) to be released on bail from a Tokyo detention house.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Steaming but Not yet Explosive
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Steaming but Not yet Explosive

Bitcoin price has been traded up in a mild fever during the latter part of today's market action. Is this a good place to join a potential uptrend? The chart technicals don't suggest ongoing advance into a profitable advance. This analysis is provided by xbt.social with a 3-hour delay.

item.title: iPayYou Pay-by-Twitter Bitcoin P2P Service | PYMNTS.com
item.description:
iPayYou Pay-by-Twitter Bitcoin P2P Service | PYMNTS.com

Bitcoin may be a preferred method of payment for a slew of tech-savvy people, but it has yet to take off with the masses, or even micro-masses. iPayYou, the bitcoin wallet, is aiming to change that with a new service launched today (July 14).

item.title: How The Brexit Is Affecting The Bitcoin And Blockchain Industries
item.description:
How The Brexit Is Affecting The Bitcoin And Blockchain Industries

The Juxtaposition Of The U.K And E.U. Flags Walking down the streets of Madrid on June 24th, 2016 during a business trip, I began to hear murmurs around every corner. I don't speak Spanish very well, but there was one word I could make out, "Brexit". This topic seemed to have [...]

item.title: IBM to Open Innovation Centre in Singapore, Focusing on Blockchain Apps
item.description:
IBM to Open Innovation Centre in Singapore, Focusing on Blockchain Apps

The growing disruptive implications of Blockchain in a range of settings including the financial and health sectors is key to IBM's decision to open an innovation center in Singapore.

item.title: New Exchange-Traded Product SolidX Bitcoin Trust to Launch on NYSE Arca
item.description:
New Exchange-Traded Product SolidX Bitcoin Trust to Launch on NYSE Arca

Blockchain technology company SolidX Partners has announced that it has filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) for the proposed launch of the SolidX Bitcoin Trust, a new Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF) for traditional investors. According to the company's website, SolidX Partners provides blockchain-based software solutions relating to the indelible recording of digital records, transfer of assets, and identity.

item.title: When is the estimated date that segregated witness gets fully implemented worldwide?
item.description:
When is the estimated date that segregated witness gets fully implemented worldwide?

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. It's 100% free, no registration required. Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top I read the news recently that reviews had already been done and that the segregated witness program will be on deployment soon, so when is it expected to be fully adapted worldwide?
